node.text: I agree, I watched an morning  program of so called guruji who gives you solution for all your trouble saying, school year has started so make sure you dress your girl child fully, alter the uniforms length of required, I never from him giving advice to boy's saying anything and he is a person where people gather in thousands to take his blessings, how do you educate them, it's scary thinking even the so called educates follow such people.
Does sitting in Tv studio and showing your vocabulary skills change anything ? I have never seen a result out of such discussions @trishashetty

Really upsetting and unfortunate to get the update that the police filed a ‘B summary report’ in actor Tanushree Dutta’s case; where she alleged sexual harassment against actor Nana Patekar and reignited the MeToo movement in India. A ‘B summary report’ means that the IO (police) has found no evidence to file the chargesheet. Tanushree Dutta alleges that the police has not followed due process and that her witnesses were not called to give testimony. She continues her crusade of over a decade to seek justice and will file a petition in High Court. 
On the basis on the facts put forth in her case and having worked on ground on these issues, I stand in solidarity with Tanushree. 
This is not solely a one-woman problem. Sexual harassment affects us all. In India, conviction rate for crimes against women is 19%. Whereas the avg conviction rate for other crimes is 47%. Pending cases for crimes against women increased from 1081756 to 1204786. 
Out of which 1/3rd of the cases police investigation still hasn’t wrapped up and delay has been from the police’s end. There is no effective process to ensure compliance when it comes to sexual harassment at the workplace (POSH Act). We expect women to “speak up and be strong” and when they do, they get victim blamed and shamed, ostracised at the workplace and are seen as “non-complaint and unhirable”. Even those who follow due process and seek legal recourse are met with systematic hurdles and failures. If we are serious about our country’s development then we need to address these systematic failures head on. 
We need to stop letting down the women of our country and do everything we can to remove these barriers that stop us from seeking employment, working and living a quality life. #MeToo
Would love to collab! Please help us fight against domestic abuse. Message us!🌙

@rajsheth27 have u seen the news about car incidence? it was vadalised by team oh news reporter whoose camera was broken by Tanushri... was there any evidence supporting the blame that those ppl were sent by Nana patekar?

@trishashetty it is not about highlighting the truth it is about proving it in a court of law. And I don't see any relation between vandalism of her car and her charges of abuse and harassment. And we should believe it just because she is a woman that will be against the principle of natural justice. With due respect to you as I know about your work but only believing something cannot prove it.
@trishashetty just for the record, the dowry law is one of most abused law. presumptuous laws or decision is not good for anyone.
so according to u, anything that woman says should be considered as  a fact? an men should be considered guilty untill proven?
@shruticlicks yes and yes!!! Thank you for using your platforms to highlight this issue 💕
Well said! The system continues to fail women from speaking their truth, getting justice & leading a life free of bias and harassment!

@trishashetty hmm, yes I totally agree. I just feel like some people aren’t willing to understand or empathize — they always find a reason to hate on whatever you say, and being an ardent fan of yours that bothers me. But most of all I know you will always be the honest, authentic, fearless voice that you are — and whatever direction you take, some of us will ALWAYS be there supporting you and your cause. ❤️
@trishashetty *not to fall
@nitiimajethia ❤️❤️
I’m so proud of you @trishashetty  You give so many people like us hope. You don’t have to respond to all the trolls, you don’t owe them your time. Thank you for being you ❤️

@vicky_okay_ I understand your skepticism, I struggled with the same. But the topics I work on are considered ‘uncomfortable and taboo’ and people more often than not just don’t want to listen. So I try to go on platforms where people consume news to ensure that my message isn’t just circulating amongst ‘converted circles’. Also we have had many survivors reach out to us to seek help, after watching our segments on these very same platforms. That is why I participate in these debates. I also have the utmost respect those who have banned these networks and choose not to go and speak there.
Times now? Seriously?
What's media crisis then?

Well said. If law and order were that effective in this country, there wouldn't have been a movement like #MeToo. We need social cleansing movements. Take help of social media, or any form of media for that matter & voice your opinions. 🙌
Am really disappointed that @poojabediofficial is actually defending Nana Patekar🙄
Who is Pooja Bedi always trying to impress by shunning agrieved women !!!!

I'm sorry but her story has not been consistent. She has spoken clearly in an interview a few time before she came up with this FIR against Nana patekar that , fortunately she has never met any1 who has troubled her or harassed her in any way. Global Metoo movement is legit but this woman may not be the right person to lead MetooIndia..

MeToo movement was not anywhere actually going to do any good to women. Do the real work outside in the court of law or in the real world out there. This social media is an illusion and nothing actually materialise from here.
Too Good Trisha, I know mission impossible will be successful. After TedTalks shoot visit.. my best wishes to u and would love to be incolved in ur mission.
I think women like Pooja Bedi and many others are the reason why we are failing our women everyday
Thank you so much for doing this.Cannot believe pooja(whatsoever) is defending a man who harrased Tanushree Dutta
So utterly disappointing
Very unfortunate😡 this could have set an example.
